Wal Mart will soon be selling Biblical Action Figures.
 Here's the link.
 
 So, how many new idoloters will be made with this sure fire winner?
 I love the marketing to Christians. 
 It proves the old adage 'A fool and his money are soon parted.'
 
 I wonder how long it will take before some genius child has them battling the might forces of the Empire in the guise of Darth Vader and his storm troopers.
 
 Or, uses the talking 12" figure to Save Bratz dolls from their evil ways.
 
 emoticon_xbouncer
Jebus is very trendy these days.

http://www.blessedtoys.com/cgi-bin/xlite/modules/shop/bin/view_product.cgi?product_id=MOF50527&reseller=joshl
 
 Doesn't it just say "Buddy Christ"?

 
 
 I actually own a bobble headed Buddy Christ figure.
 
 When ever I'm needing my miracles or wanting my wishes granted, I say the proper and magical words found in the bible, apply my full faith to the subject, then ask for my hearts desire and finally verbally confess my blessings and reach out and poke Jesus on the head. ALWAYS, I'm greated with a nod of approval that my wishes will soon come true.
 
 It's greater than a Magic 8 Ball.
 
 Of course, like with everyone else...
 Nothing really happens.
 
 But, it gives me a sense of well being.
 
 
 
 The really silly thing is the above method (sans the poking bobbly headed Christ on the noggin) is exactly the summation of the Word of Faith movement's beliefs.
 Or course, they have the magical 'sowing of the seed to prove your faith' (seed always being something of worth like cash or a car given to the pastor) that they are commanded to do before they can reap the harvest and get their heaerts desire (which is also what god wants for you...bible sey so!!1!@)
